evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

node.statement: Mechanical control components respond correctly to input commands

defeaters: If evidence showed the tug driver intentionally ignored controls or procedural deviation, or communication breakdown caused the event, the conclusion might change.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H4 shows the aircraft moved beyond the Tug release point despite engine at idle, indicating mechanical control components did not respond correctly, favoring mechanical control failure over environmental deficiency.
outcome.uncertainty_source: missing evidence / ambiguity

children_spec.statement: Pushback crew was present and available at the scheduled pushback time
children_spec.test_procedure: Check crew attendance logs and communication records to confirm presence at pushback time

children_spec.statement: Pushback equipment was operational and ready for use during the pushback procedure
children_spec.test_procedure: Review maintenance and operational status reports of pushback equipment at the time of the event

children_spec.statement: Required pushback documentation and clearances were available and accessible to the crew
children_spec.test_procedure: Verify availability of pushback clearance documents and procedural checklists used by the crew

children_spec.statement: Communication channels between the cockpit and ground crew were available and functioning during pushback
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine communication logs and equipment functionality reports for the pushback period
